p: Our data disagree with the literature on inhibitory activity exerted by essential oils of Salvia species on seed germination (Mancini et al., 2009[ 32]; Muller and Muller, 1964[ 37]; Singh et al., 2006[ 48]). Significant interactions (p < 0.05) between seed species and treatments (with or without SoEo) were also noted in radicle and hypocotyl lengths and weights (Figure 3 (Fig. 3)). Indeed, radicle length and hypocotyl length of T. aestivum and T. foenum-graecum seeds were significantly inhibited by the SoEO, while stimulation was observed on S. lycopersicum and R. sativus seeds, in comparison to untreated seeds. Fresh weight of roots and hypocotyls of T. aestivum and T. foenum-graecum also decreased by the SoEO, compared to the untreated seeds (Figure 3 (Fig. 3)).
